byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and RICK ROJAS

abstract: New York City Council reveals details of package of bills that will increase pay of council members to $148,500 per year, increase of over 30 percent from current base salaries; bills will also implement provisions regulating outside income and financial disclosures, changes that have been called for by good-government advocacy groups; critics wonder whether large increase in salary is tied to support for Mayor Bill de Blasio's plan for horse-carriage industry.

headline.print_headline: City Council May Vote on Its Raise and a Horse-Carriage Bill on the Same Day
headline.main: New York Council May Vote on Raise and Horse-Carriage Bill on Same Day

snippet: As the Council completed a package of bills on lawmakers’ raises, questions surfaced about possible links to a bill shrinking the horse-cab industry.
lead_paragraph: As the Council completed a package of bills on lawmakers’ raises, questions surfaced about possible links to a bill shrinking the horse-cab industry.
